snippet: Despite an international effort to block it, Syria’s governing Assad family exploited large loopholes, lax enforcement and a far greater emphasis on limiting the spread of nuclear arms.
abstract: Diplomatic and intelligence records show that Syria amassed one of world's largest stockpiles of chemical weapons with help from Soviet Union and Iran, as well as Western European suppliers and even American companies; archives released by WikiLeaks show that Syria's governing Assad family exploited large loopholes, lax enforcement and greater emphasis on limiting nuclear arms in order to build country's arsenal.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER, ANDREW W. LEHREN and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington, and Andrew W. Lehren and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Despite an international effort to block it, Syria’s governing Assad family exploited large loopholes, lax enforcement and a far greater emphasis on limiting the spread of nuclear arms.
